alert.note: Alert for Champaign; Piatt (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Central Illinois (Central and East Central Illinois)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 07 at 4:13AM CDT until May 07 at 8:15AM CDT by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: The National Weather Service in Lincoln has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Northern Piatt County in central Illinois... Central Champaign County in east central Illinois... * Until 815 AM CDT. * At 412 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Up to 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Champaign, Rantoul, Urbana, Savoy, Mahomet, St. Joseph, Fisher, Thomasboro, Mansfield, Ogden, De Land, Bondville, Lake Of The Woods, Seymour, Royal, Flatville, Galesville and Lodge. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
